uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools
Class Viewer

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--uk.ac.leeds.ccg.geotools.Viewer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, ScaleChangedListener, java.io.Serializable, ThemeChangedListener
Direct Known Subclasses:
GraphViewer
public class Viewer
extends java.awt.Component
implements ScaleChangedListener, ThemeChangedListener

Viewer is a medium for displaying geographic maps in applets and applications. The map to display is built up from information stored in a number of thmes.

To construct a working viewer you need to understand how to construct themes and layers, a task that will be made easer over time as more helper classes are writen.

A viewer has the ability to build up a scaled image from upto three parts 1)any number of static themes - not animated at all 2)a sequence of single static themes 3)animated themes

Version:
0.8.0 GeoTools is a Java class library for developing interactive mapping applets and applications. Copyright (C) 1999 James Macgill, Ian Turton. This file along with the whole GeoTools library is available under the GNU LGPL You can contact the author at James Macgill Center for Computational Geography School of Geography Leeds University Leeds W.Yorkshire UK LS2 9JT j.macgill@geog.leeds.ac.uk Thanks to Joachim Bröckl (saltag) for bug fixes
Author:
James Macgill, Ian Turton

Constructor Detail

Viewer

public Viewer()

Viewer

public Viewer(boolean activeMouse)
Default constructor for a viewer. Sets up and initalises a new viewer, it won't do much however untill it has at least one theme added to it.
See Also:
addTheme, addSaticTheme, addSequenceTheme

setMapExtentByFactor

public void setMapExtentByFactor(double zoomFactor)
Scales the map by the given zoomfactor. The lower bound of zooming is the full map containing all themes. there is no upper bound. this is probably deprecated, and will be removed in the near future

setMapExtentByValue

public void setMapExtentByValue(double scaleFactor)
specify an absolute scaleFactor. This method is likely to changed in the near future.

setScale

public void setScale(Scaler scale_)

the setMapExtent is probaly what you are after

setTool

public void setTool(Tool t)
Sets the active tool for this viewer.
Call this method to change the tool for this viewer, tools available by default include ZoomTool,PanTool and SelectTool.
an example call would be

view.setTool(new ZoomTool());

Parameters:
t - The new tool to use.
Since:
0.7.7.2 June 6 2000

getTool

public Tool getTool()
Returns the active tool being used by this viewer.
